intro: Hieracium subaustrinum, commonly known as the southern hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces yellowish to brownish flower heads composed of numerous small florets. Hieracium subaustrinum is often found in coastal areas and can thrive in relatively dry conditions.
